code: # Read TXT file with BioCyc pathways for P. putida KT2440 custom_df <-   read.table(     system.file("BioCyc_pathways_KT2440.txt", package = "VisomX"),     sep = "\t",     header = T,     stringsAsFactors = F,     fill = T,     na.strings = "",     quote = "",     comment.char = "",     check.names = F   )  # Run workflow and export results results <- prot.workflow(se = data,         imp_fun = "SampMin",         type = "all",         alpha = 0.05,         lfc = 1,         pathway_enrichment = TRUE,         pathway_kegg = TRUE,         kegg_organism = "ppu",         custom_pathways = custom_df,         volcano.add_names = FALSE, # show protein labels in volcano         report = FALSE,         out.dir = tempdir()         ) ## Running proteomics workflow in the directory:/tmp/Rtmp5T4KSJ ## 316 proteins were found to be differentially expressed with alpha = 0.05 and |log2(fold change)| > 1. ## Save results as tab-delimited table to: /tmp/Rtmp5T4KSJ/results.txt ## Save RData object ## Writing results of KEGG pathway enrichment analysis to: /tmp/Rtmp5T4KSJ/pora_kegg_contrast...txt' ## Writing results of custom pathway enrichment analysis to: /tmp/Rtmp5T4KSJ/pora_custom_contrast...txt

title: Reliable and extensive analysis of Proteomics data with package `VisomX`
text: customization certain computational steps required, steps included within prot.workflow() can also performed manually. following steps required end results list object obtained workflow function:
code: # 1.  Perform data normalization:  prot_norm <- prot.normalize_vsn(se)  # 2.  Missing value imputation  #    a.   with imp_fun == "MinProb":         prot_imp <- prot.impute(prot_norm, fun = imp_fun, q = q)  #    b.  with imp_fun == "knn":         prot_imp <- prot.impute(prot_norm, fun = imp_fun, rowmax = knn.rowmax)  #    c.  for all other methods:         prot_imp <- prot.impute(prot_norm, fun = imp_fun)  # 3.  Principal component analysis prot_pca <- prot.pca(SummarizedExperiment::assay(prot_imp))  # 4.  Test for differential expression by empirical Bayes moderation of a linear model and defined contrasts: prot_diff <- prot.test_diff(prot_imp, type = type, control = control, test = contrast)  # 5.  Denote significantly differential proteins:  prot_dep <- prot.add_rejections(prot_diff, alpha = alpha, lfc = lfc)  # 6.  Generate a results table:  prot_res <- prot.get_results(prot_dep)  # 7.  Pathway enrichment analysis  #    a. Get vector of tested contrasts:          contrasts <- SummarizedExperiment::rowData(prot_dep) %>%           data.frame(check.names = FALSE) %>%           select(ends_with("_diff")) %>%           colnames() %>% str_replace_all("_diff", "")          #    b. Perform pathway enrichment analysis         res.pathway <- enrich_pathways(prot_dep, contrasts, alpha_pathways = alpha_pathways,                                    pathway_kegg = pathway_kegg, kegg_organism = kegg_organism,                                    custom_pathways = custom_pathways)  # 8.  Assemble results into list         results <- list(data = SummarizedExperiment::rowData(se), se = se, norm = prot_norm,                   imputed = prot_imp, pca = prot_pca, diff = prot_diff, dep = prot_dep,                   results = results, param = param)

title: Used by higher functions for non-specific filtering of variables — met.PerformFeatureFilter
text: int.mat Data matrix samples rows features columns, generated higher function. mSetObj Enter name created mSet object (see InitDataObjects Read.TextData). filter (Character) Select option unspecific filtering based following ranking criteria: "none" apply unspecific filtering. "rsd" filters features low relative standard deviation across dataset. "nrsd" non-parametric relative standard deviation. "mean" filters features low mean intensity value across dataset. "median" filters features low median intensity value across dataset. "sd" filters features low absolute standard deviation across dataset. "mad" filters features low median absolute deviation across dataset. "iqr" filters features low inter-quartile range across dataset. remain.num (Numerical) Enter number variables keep dataset. NULL, following empirical rules applied data filtering methods specified filter = "": Less 250 variables: 5% filtered 250 - 500 variables: 10% filtered 500 - 1000 variables: 25% filtered 1000 variables: 40% filtered anal.type (Character) Type analysis. Extracted mSetObj higher function mSetObj$analSet$type. .rsd (Numeric NULL) Apply filter based -group relative standard deviation (RSD, %) NULL. Therefore, RSD every feature calculated every group dataset. RSD variable group exceeds indicated threshold, removed dataset. filter can applied addition filtering methods especially useful perform data technical replicates.

title: Impute missing variables — met.impute
text: mSetObj Enter name created mSet object ((see met.initialize Read.TextData). method (Character) Select option replace missing variables: "lod" replaces missing values 1/5 minimum value respective variable. "rowmin" replaces missing values half sample minimum. "colmin" replaces missing values half feature minimum. "mean" replaces missing values mean value respective feature column. "median" replaces missing values median value respective feature column. "knn_var" imputes missing values finding features training set “closest” averages nearby points fill value. "knn_smp" imputes missing values finding samples training set “closest” averages nearby points fill value. "bpca" applies Bayesian PCA impute missing values. "ppca" applies probabilistic PCA impute missing values. "svdImpute" applies singular value decomposition impute missing values.

what: Plot PLS-DA classification performance using different components — met.plot_PLS.Crossvalidation
title: Plot PLS-DA classification performance using different components — met.plot_PLS.Crossvalidation
text: met.plot_PLS.Crossvalidation performs cross-validation (CV) generated PLS-DA model, fraction data held back, model trained rest. CV, predicted data compared original data, sum squared errors calculated. prediction error summed samples (Predicted Residual Sum Squares PRESS). convenience, PRESS divided initial sum squares subtracted 1 resemble scale R2. Good predictions low PRESS high Q2. Generally speaking, model R2 (Q2) value 0.7 can considered predictive. possible negative Q2, means model predictive overfitted.

code: met.plot_heatmap(   mSetObj = NA,   imgName = "Heatmap_features",   format = "pdf",   dpi = NULL,   width = NA,   dataOpt = "norm",   scaleOpt = "row",   smplDist = "euclidean",   clstDist = "ward.D",   palette = "bwm",   viewOpt = "detail",   rowV = T,   colV = T,   var.inx = NULL,   border = T,   grp.ave = F,   plot = TRUE,   export = TRUE )

title: Create heat map of hierarchically clustered features and samples — met.plot_heatmap
text: mSetObj Input name created mSet object. imgName (Character) Enter name image file (export = TRUE). format ("png" "pdf") image file format (export = TRUE). dpi (Numeric) resolution image file (export = TRUE). NULL, resolution chosen automatically based  chosen file format (300 dpi PNG, 72 dpi PDF) width (Numeric) width image file inches (export = TRUE). dataOpt (Character) Set data options. Choose "norm" use data normalization string use original values. scaleOpt (Character) Set value standardization option. "row" autoscaling features, "column" autoscaling samples, "none" autoscaling. smplDist (Character) Enter sample distance method: "euclidean" Euclidean distance, "correlation" Pearson distance, "minkowski" Minkowski method. clstDist (Character) Enter feature clustering method: "ward.d", "average", "complete", "single". palette Input color palette choice: "bwm" Blue-White-Red, "gbr" Green-Black-Red, "heat" Red-Yellow, "topo" topological colors, "gray" gray-scale. viewOpt Set view options, choose "detail" "overview". rowV (Logical) Shall clustering applied samples? colV (Logical) Shall clustering applied features? var.inx (Numeric vector) optional: Provide indeces selected features plotted. border (Logical) Indicate whether show cell-borders. grp.ave (Logical) Shall group averages shown (opposed displaying every sample)? plot (Logical, TRUE FALSE) Shall plot returned RStudio 'Plots' pane? export (Logical, TRUE FALSE) Shall plot exported PDF PNG file?

title: Volcano Plot — met.plot_volcano
code: met.plot_volcano(   mSetObj = NA,   grp1,   grp2,   test = "ttest",   paired = FALSE,   nonpar = FALSE,   equal.var = TRUE,   log2fc.thresh = 1,   threshp = 0.05,   pval.type = "fdr",   imgName = NULL,   format = "pdf",   add_names = TRUE,   label_size = 3,   dpi = NULL,   width = NA,   plot = TRUE,   export = TRUE,   silent = FALSE,   test_condition = FALSE )

title: Volcano Plot — met.plot_volcano
text: mSetObj Input name created mSet object, Data container ANOVA analysis (met.ANOVA.Anal) test = "anova". grp1 (Character) Enter name first group contrast grp1 vs. grp2. group arguments empty, first two names list groups selected. grp2 (Character) Enter name second group contrast grp1 vs. grp2. group arguments empty, first two names list groups selected. test (Character) Choose statistical tests. test = "ttest", met.plot_volcano runs met.Ttests.Anal chosen test parameters. test = "anova", met.ANOVA.Anal must applied previously mSetObj. paired (Logical) data paired (TRUE) (FALSE). applicable test = "ttest". nonpar (Logical) Use non-parametric test (TRUE) (FALSE). applicable test = "ttest". equal.var (Logical) two groups equal variance (TRUE) (FALSE). applicable test = "ttest". log2fc.thresh (Numeric) Enter relevance threshold log2 fold changes, highlighted plot vertical lines colored compounds threshp (Numeric) Enter significance threshold features based T-test ANOVA test results, highlighted plot horizontal line colored compounds pval.type (Character) Display apply significance threshold "raw" p values adjusted p values ("fdr"). imgName (Character) Enter name image file (export = TRUE). NULL, name Plots/Volcano_grp1_vs_grp2 assigned. format ("png" "pdf") image file format (export = TRUE). add_names (Logical) Display labels significant features (TRUE) (FALSE). label_size (Numeric) Font size feature labels (add_names = TRUE). dpi (Numeric) resolution image file (export = TRUE). NULL, resolution chosen automatically based  chosen file format (300 dpi PNG, 72 dpi PDF) width (Numeric) width image file inches (export = TRUE). plot (Logical, TRUE FALSE) Shall plot returned RStudio 'Plots' pane? export (Logical, TRUE FALSE) Shall plot exported PDF PNG file? silent (Logical) Shall results met.Ttests.Anal printed console (TRUE) (FALSE)? test_condition (Logical) Add subtitle applied data transformation scaling methods displayed plot title (TRUE) (FALSE).

what: Construct mSet data container, read metabolomics data, filter data, and impute missing values — met.read_data
title: Construct mSet data container, read metabolomics data, filter data, and impute missing values — met.read_data
text: met.read_data wrapper function constructs mSet object, adds data table file R dataframe object, applies unspecific user-defined data filters, imputes missing values.

title: Construct mSet data container, read metabolomics data, filter data, and impute missing values — met.read_data
code: met.read_data(   data,   data.type = "conc",   anal.type = "stat",   paired = FALSE,   csvsep = ";",   dec = ".",   sheet = 1,   data.format = "rowu",   lbl.type = "disc",   filt.feat = c(""),   filt.smpl = c(""),   filt.grp = c(""),   filt.method = "none",   remain.num = NULL,   qcFilter = "F",   qc.rsd = 25,   all.rsd = NULL,   imp.method = "lod",   export = FALSE,   img.format = "pdf",   dpi = dpi )

title: Construct mSet data container, read metabolomics data, filter data, and impute missing values — met.read_data
text: data Enter name R dataframe object "path name" (quotes) CSV/TSV/XLS/XLSX/TXT file read. data.type (Character) type data, either "list" (Compound lists), "conc" (Compound concentration data), "specbin" (Binned spectra data), "pktable" (Peak intensity table), "nmrpeak" (NMR peak lists), "mspeak" (MS peak lists), "msspec" (MS spectra data). anal.type (Character) Indicate analysis module performed: "stat", "pathora", "pathqea", "msetora", "msetssp", "msetqea", "ts", "cmpdmap", "smpmap", "pathinteg". paired (Logical) Indicate data paired (TRUE) (FALSE). csvsep (Character) Enter separator used CSV file (applicable reading ".csv" file). dec (Character) decimal separator used CSV, TSV TXT files. sheet (Integer Character string) Number name sheet proteomics data XLS XLSX files (optional). data.format (Character) Specify samples paired rows ("rowp"), unpaired rows ("rowu"), columns paired ("colp"), columns unpaired ("colu"). lbl.type (Character) Specify group label type, either categorical ("disc") continuous ("cont"). filt.feat (Character Vector) Enter names features remove dataset. filt.smpl (Character Vector) Enter names samples remove dataset. filt.grp (Character Vector) Enter names groups remove dataset. filt.method (Character) Select option unspecific filtering based following ranking criteria: "none" apply unspecific filtering. "rsd" filters features low relative standard deviation across dataset. "nrsd" non-parametric relative standard deviation. "mean" filters features low mean intensity value across dataset. "median" filters features low median intensity value across dataset. "sd" filters features low absolute standard deviation across dataset. "mad" filters features low median absolute deviation across dataset. "iqr" filters features low inter-quartile range across dataset. remain.num (Numerical) Enter number variables keep dataset. NULL, following empirical rules applied data filtering methods specified filter = "": Less 250 variables: 5% filtered 250 - 500 variables: 10% filtered 500 - 1000 variables: 25% filtered 1000 variables: 40% filtered qcFilter (Logical) Filter variables based relative standard deviation features quality control (QC) samples (TRUE), (FALSE). filter can applied addition , unspecific filtering methods. qc.rsd (Numeric) Define relative standard deviation cut-%. Variables RSD greater number QC samples removed dataset. necessary specify argument qcFilter TRUE. Otherwise, ignored. .rsd (Numeric NULL) Apply filter based -group relative standard deviation (RSD, %) NULL. Therefore, RSD every feature calculated every group dataset. RSD variable group exceeds indicated threshold, removed dataset. filter can applied addition filtering methods especially useful perform data technical replicates. imp.method (Character) Select option replace missing variables: "lod" replaces missing values 1/5 minimum value respective variable. "rowmin" replaces missing values half sample minimum. "colmin" replaces missing values half feature minimum. "mean" replaces missing values mean value respective feature column. "median" replaces missing values median value respective feature column. "knn_var" imputes missing values finding features training set “closest” averages nearby points fill value. "knn_smp" imputes missing values finding samples training set “closest” averages nearby points fill value. "bpca" applies Bayesian PCA impute missing values. "ppca" applies probabilistic PCA impute missing values. "svdImpute" applies singular value decomposition impute missing values. export (Logical, TRUE FALSE) Shall missing value detection plots exported PDF PNG file? img.format (Character, "png" "pdf") image file format (export = TRUE). dpi (Numeric) resolution exported PNG PDF images.

title: Construct mSet data container, read metabolomics data, filter data, and impute missing values — met.read_data
text: mSet object (built ascending order): original data mSetObj$dataSet$data_orig. data manually filtered features/samples/groups mSetObj$dataSet$edit. data unspecifically filtered data  mSetObj$dataSet$filt. data imputed missing values mSetObj$dataSet$data_proc. missing value heatmap mSetObj$imgSet$missval_heatmap.plot (see met.plot_missval). Density CumSum plots intensities proteins without missing values mSetObj$imgSet$missval_density.plot (see met.plot_detect).

text: Nicolas T. Wirth mail.nicowirth@gmail.com Technical University Denmark License: GNU GPL (>= 2)

what: Test for optimal data processing conditions — met.test_normalization
title: Test for optimal data processing conditions — met.test_normalization
text: met.test_normalization runs metabolomics analysis workflow several normalization/transformation/scaling combinations parallel. workflow includes univariate analysis (ANOVA) multivariate analyses (PCA PLS-DA) creates report various performance indicators help deciding optimal data preprocessing conditions.

title: Test for optimal data processing conditions — met.test_normalization
code: met.test_normalization(   mSetObj,   test_conditions = NULL,   ref = NULL,   class_order = FALSE,   alpha = 0.05,   lfc = 2,   posthoc_method = "tukey",   nonpar = FALSE,   pls.cv.method = "LOOCV",   pls.cv.k = 10,   dpi = 300,   pls.data = "all",   permut.num = 500,   vip.thresh = 1,   report = FALSE,   report.dir = NULL,   export = FALSE,   export.format = "pdf",   export.dir = "met.Test_Normalization" )

title: Test for optimal data processing conditions — met.test_normalization
text: mSetObj Enter name created mSetObj (see met.read_data) test_conditions (Character vector) Enter combinations rowNorm, transNorm, scaleNorm separated "/" tested workflow. See met.normalize suitable options. NA, normalization test workflow automatically choose c("NULL", "MeanCenter",   "LogNorm", "LogNorm/AutoNorm", "CrNorm", "CrNorm/AutoNorm", "AutoNorm", "RangeNorm",   "ParetoNorm") default conditions. Please note: rowNorm option "SpecNorm" supported workflow. ref (Character vector) Enter name(s) reference sample(s) reference feature(s) rowNorm = "GroupPQN", "SamplePQN", "CompNorm" respective order test_conditions. Add "NULL" ref argument applicable respective test_condition. class_order (Logical, TRUE FALSE) Class order matters (.e. implying time points, disease severity, etc.) alpha (Numeric) Enter significance threshold adjusted p values (false discovery rate - FDR; ANOVA post-hoc analyses). lfc (Numeric) Enter relevance threshold log2 fold changes pair-wise comparisons (ANOVA post-hoc analyses). posthoc_method (Character) Enter name ANOVA post-hoc test, "fisher" "tukey". nonpar (Logical) Use non-parametric ANOVA test (TRUE) (FALSE). pls.cv.method (Character) Enter one two methods PLS-DA model (cross) validation: "LOOCV" performs leave-one-cross validation "CV" performs k-fold cross validation. pls.cv.k (Numeric) number (randomized) groups dataset split cross validation methodName = "CV". value must equal smaller number samples. dpi (Numeric) Resolution PNG images (default 300 dpi). pls.data (Character) Enter "" train PLS(-DA) model whole (filtered normalized) dataset "anova" use subset features defined significant based ANOVA analysis. permut.num (Numeric) Number permutations PLS-DA permutation tests. vip.thresh (Numeric) Enter chosen relevance threshold PLS-DA VIP scores. report (Logical) Generate report results workflow (TRUE) (FALSE). report.dir (Character) Enter name location folder report files generated report = TRUE. NULL (default), new folder "Report_date-time" created working directory. export (Logical) Export generated plots PDF PNG files (TRUE) (FALSE). export.format (Character, "png" "pdf") image file format (export = TRUE). export.dir (Character) Enter name location folder generated files saved.

title: Test for optimal data processing conditions — met.test_normalization
text: Nicolas T. Wirth mail.nicowirth@gmail.com Technical University Denmark License: GNU GPL (>= 2)

what: Perform metabolomics data analysis workflow — met.workflow

text: met.workflow runs metabolomics analysis workflow, including univariate analysis (ANOVA) multivariate analyses (PCA PLS-DA) creates report various graphical results.

title: Perform metabolomics data analysis workflow — met.workflow
code: met.workflow(   mSetObj,   rowNorm = "NULL",   transNorm = "NULL",   scaleNorm = "NULL",   ref = NULL,   norm.vec = NULL,   contrast.type = "all",   control = NULL,   contrast = NULL,   class_order = FALSE,   alpha = 0.05,   lfc = 2,   posthoc_method = "tukey",   nonpar = FALSE,   permut.num = 500,   vip.thresh = 1,   volcano.test = "anova",   volcano.add_names = TRUE,   volcano.label_size = 3,   volcano.adjusted = FALSE,   pls.data = "all",   pls.cv.method = "LOOCV",   pls.cv.k = 5,   plot = FALSE,   export = FALSE,   export.format = "pdf",   dpi = 300,   report = FALSE,   report.dir = NULL,   export.dir = "met.ProcessedData" )

title: Perform metabolomics data analysis workflow — met.workflow
text: mSetObj Enter name created mSet object (see met.read_data). rowNorm (Character) Select option row-wise normalization (see met.normalize options). transNorm (Character) Select option transform data (see met.normalize options). scaleNorm (Character) Select option scaling data (see met.normalize options). ref (Character) Enter name reference sample reference feature (rowNorm = "GroupPQN", "SamplePQN", "CompNorm". norm.vec (Numeric vector) Vector sample-specific scaling factors. applicable rowNorm = "SpecNorm". contrast.type (Character) Enter type contrast used ANOVA analysis. Options "" (default), "control", "manual". control (contrast.type = "control") Enter name control group (e.g. "Control") used ANOVA analysis. contrast (contrast.type = "manual") Enter contrast vector contrasts used ANOVA analysis. E.g.: "ConditionA_vs_ConditionB" c("ConditionA_vs_ConditionB", "ConditionC_vs_ConditionD"). class_order (Logical, TRUE FALSE) Class order matters (.e. implying time points, disease severity, etc.). alpha (Numeric) Enter significance threshold adjusted p values (false discovery rate - FDR; ANOVA post-hoc analyses). lfc (Numeric) Enter relevance threshold log2 fold changes pair-wise comparisons (ANOVA post-hoc analyses). posthoc_method (Character) Enter name ANOVA post-hoc test, "fisher" "tukey". nonpar (Logical) Use non-parametric ANOVA test (TRUE) (FALSE). permut.num (Numeric) Number permutations PLS-DA permutation tests. vip.thresh (Numeric) Enter chosen relevance threshold PLS-DA VIP scores. volcano.test (Character) Enter name statistical, univariate analysis perform, either "anova" "ttest". volcano.add_names (Logical) Display compound labels next dots within volcano plot (TRUE) (FALSE). volcano.label_size (Numerical) Enter font size compound labels within volcano plot (volcano.add_names = TRUE) volcano.adjusted (Logical) Display adjusted p-values y axis volcano plot (TRUE) (FALSE)? (applicable volcano.test = "ttest") pls.data (Character) Enter "" train PLS(-DA) model whole (filtered normalized) dataset "anova" use subset features defined significant based ANOVA analysis. pls.cv.method (Character) Enter one two methods PLS-DA model (cross) validation: "LOOCV" performs leave-one-cross validation "CV" performs k-fold cross validation. pls.cv.k (Numeric) number (randomized) groups dataset split cross validation methodName = "CV". value must equal smaller number samples. plot (Logical) Display generated plots Plots pane RStudio (TRUE) (FALSE). export (Logical) Export generated plots PDF PNG files (TRUE) (FALSE). export.format (Character, "png" "pdf") image file format (export = TRUE). dpi (Numeric) Resolution PNG images (default 300 dpi). report (Logical) Generate report results workflow (TRUE) (FALSE). report.dir (Character) Enter name location folder report files generated report = TRUE. NULL (default), new folder "Report_date-time" created working directory. export.dir (Character) Enter name location folder generated files saved.

what: Create a Metabolic Map from Metabolite Concentrations — met_to_map

title: Create a Metabolic Map from Metabolite Concentrations — met_to_map
code: met_to_map(   data,   csvsep = ";",   dec = ".",   sheet = 1,   RSD = 1,   groups = NULL,   titles = c(),   met_pfx = "met_",   radius_root = 3,   legend_min = NULL,   legend_max = NULL,   map_template )

title: Create a Metabolic Map from Metabolite Concentrations — met_to_map
text: data Table file dataframe object containing two metadata columns left, followed one column detected compound. Samples stored rows. two metadata columns following order: Sample group name (e.g., experimental condition organism) Replicate number. technical replicates used addition biological replicates, assign identical replicate numbers technical replicates. csvsep character, column separator input CSV files (default ";"). dec character, decimal separator input CSV, TXT, TSV files (default "."). sheet integer, sheet number read Excel files (default 1). RSD numeric value, relative standard deviation (RSD) threshold (default 1). groups list character vectors NULL, groups samples compare (default NULL). indicated groups must exist first column data. titles character vector, titles output figures. empty (default), titles represent respective group names. met_pfx character, prefix metabolite circle objects SVG map (default "met_"). radius_root (numeric) base used root transformation concentration values control size circles map. Default 3. legend_min numeric value NULL, minimum value color size scale legend. NULL (default), legend minimum chosen based minimum concentration dataset. legend_max numeric value NULL, maximum value color size scale legend. NULL (default), legend minimum chosen based maximum concentration dataset. map_template (character) file path SVG template (created InkScape) metabolic map.

title: Create a Metabolic Map from Metabolite Concentrations — met_to_map

title: Read proteomics data in table format and create SummarizedExperiment — prot.read_data
code: prot.read_data(   data = "dat_prot.csv",   expdesign = NULL,   csvsep = ";",   dec = ".",   na.strings = "",   sheet = 1,   filter = c("Reverse", "Potential contaminant"),   rsd_thresh = NULL,   name = "Gene Symbol",   id = "Ensembl Gene ID",   pfx = "abundances.",   filt_type = c("condition", "complete", "fraction", NULL),   filt_thr = 3,   filt_min = NULL,   log2_transform = TRUE )

title: Read proteomics data in table format and create SummarizedExperiment — prot.read_data
text: data R dataframe object table file extension '.xlsx', '.xls', '.csv', '.tsv', '.txt' containing proteomics data. table must contain: column protein IDs (e.g., accession numbers). header column provided argument id. column protein names. header column provided argument name. X columns containing abundance values X samples. column headers must prefix (e.g., "abundances.") provided argument pfx. Replicates identified identical column headers followed underscore replicate number (e.g., "abundances.ConditionA_1", "abundances.ConditionA_2", "abundances.ConditionA_3", ...). expdesign (optional, made previously) R dataframe object table file containing columns 'label', 'condition', 'replicate' label = "condition_replicate". NULL, experimental design table created automatically. csvsep (Character string) separator used CSV files (ignored file types). Default: ";" dec (Character string) decimal separator used CSV, TSV TXT files (ignored file types). Default: "." na.strings character vector strings interpreted NA values. sheet (Integer Character string) Number name sheet proteomics data XLS XLSX files (optional). filter (Character string vector strings) Provide header column containing "+" "-" indicate proteins discarded kept, respectively. rsd_thresh (Numeric, optional) Provide relative standard deviation (RSD) threshold % proteins. RSD calculated condition maximum RSD value determined given protein exceeds rsd_thresh, protein discarded. RSD filter applied missing value filters based three filt_ arguments. name (Character string) Provide header column containing protein names. id (Character string) Provide header column containing protein IDs pfx (Character string) Provide common prefix headers containing abundance values (e.g., "abundances."). filt_type (Character string) "complete", "condition" "fraction", Sets type filtering applied. "complete" keep proteins valid values samples. "condition" keep proteins maximum filt_thr missing values least one condition. "fraction" keep proteins filt_min fraction valid values samples. filt_thr (Integer) Sets threshold allowed number missing values least one condition filt_type = "condition". words: "keep proteins maximum 'filt_thr' missing values least one condition." filt_min (Numeric) Sets threshold minimum fraction valid values allowed protein filt_type = "fraction". log2_transform (Logical) data log2 transformed?

what: Run a complete proteomics analysis workflow. — prot.workflow
title: Run a complete proteomics analysis workflow. — prot.workflow
text: prot.workflow performs variance stabilization normalization (prot.normalize_vsn), missing value imputation (prot.impute), principal component analysis (prot.pca), differential enrichment test (prot.test_diff), pathway enrichment analysis. desired, standardized plots report generated exported separate files.

title: Run a complete proteomics analysis workflow. — prot.workflow
code: prot.workflow(   se,   normalize = TRUE,   imp_fun = c("SampMin", "man", "bpca", "knn", "QRILC", "MLE", "MinDet", "MinProb",     "min", "zero", "mixed", "nbavg"),   q = 0.01,   knn.rowmax = 0.5,   type = c("all", "control", "manual"),   control = NULL,   contrast = NULL,   alpha = 0.05,   alpha_pathways = 0.1,   lfc = 1,   heatmap.show_all = TRUE,   heatmap.kmeans = F,   k = 6,   heatmap.col_limit = NA,   heatmap.show_row_names = TRUE,   heatmap.row_font_size = 6,   volcano.add_names = FALSE,   volcano.label_size = 2.5,   volcano.adjusted = TRUE,   plot = FALSE,   plot_volcano,   export = FALSE,   report = TRUE,   report.dir = NULL,   pathway_enrichment = FALSE,   pathway_kegg = FALSE,   kegg_organism = NULL,   custom_pathways = NULL,   out.dir = NULL )

title: Run a complete proteomics analysis workflow. — prot.workflow
text: se SummarizedExperiment object, proteomics data parsed prot.read_data. normalize (Logical) data normalized via variance stabilization normalization? imp_fun (Character string)  Function used data imputation. "SampMin", "man", "bpca", "knn", "QRILC", "MLE", "MinDet", "MinProb", "min", "zero", "mixed", "nbavg". See (prot.impute) details. q (Numeric) q value imputing missing values method imp_fun = 'MinProb'. knn.rowmax (Numeric) maximum percent missing data allowed row imp_fun = 'knn'. Default: 0.5. type (Character string) Type differential analysis perform. "" (contrast condition every condition), "control" (contrast condition defined control condition), "manual" (manually define selected conditions). control (Character string) name control condition type = control. contrast (Character string vector strings) Define contrasts tested type = manual form: "ConditionA_vs_ConditionB", c("ConditionA_vs_ConditionC", "ConditionB_vs_ConditionC"). alpha (Numeric) Significance threshold adjusted p values. alpha_pathways (Numeric) Significance threshold adjusted p values pathway enrichment analysis. lfc (Numeric) Relevance threshold log2(fold change) values. proteins |log2(fold change)| value lfc given contrast considered "significant" (additionally fullfil alpha criterion). heatmap.show_all (Logical) Shall samples displayed heat map (TRUE) samples contained defined contrast (FALSE)? heatmap.kmeans (Logical) Shall proteins clustered heat map k-nearest neighbour method (TRUE) FALSE)? k (Integer) Number protein clusters heat map heatmap.kmeans = TRUE. heatmap.col_limit (Integer) Define outer breaks heat map legend. Example: heatmap.col_limit = 3, color scale span -3 3. Alls values -3 color -3, values 3 color 3. heatmap.show_row_names (Logical) Show protein names heat map (TRUE) FALSE). heatmap.row_font_size (Numeric) Font size protein names heat maps heatmap.show_row_names = TRUE. volcano.add_names (Logical) Show protein names volcano plots (TRUE) FALSE). volcano.label_size (Numeric) Font size protein names volcano plots volcano.add_names = TRUE. volcano.adjusted (Logical) Shall adjusted p values shown y axis volcano plots (TRUE) raw p values (FALSE)?. plot (Logical) Show generated plots Plots pane RStudio (TRUE) FALSE). plot_volcano (Logical) Show volcano plot Plots pane RStudio (TRUE) FALSE). export (Logical) Exported generated plots PNG PDF files (TRUE) FALSE). report (Logical) Render export report PDF HTML format summarizes results (TRUE) FALSE). report.dir (Character string) Provide name path folder report saved. pathway_enrichment (Logical) Perform pathway -representation analysis tested contrast (TRUE) FALSE). pathway_kegg (Logical) Perform pathway -representation analysis gene sets KEGG database (TRUE) FALSE). kegg_organism (Character string) Identifier organism KEGG database (pathway_kegg = TRUE) custom_pathways (R dataframe object) Data frame providing custom pathway annotations. table must contain "Pathway" column listing identified pathway studies organism, "Accession" column listing proteins (genes) pathway composed . Accession entries must match protein IDs. .dir (Character string) absolute path location result TXT files exported .

title: Run a complete proteomics analysis workflow. — prot.workflow
text: list containing SummarizedExperiment object every computation step workflow, pca object, lists - regulated pathways tested contrast method (KEGG /custom).

text: se SummarizedExperiment object, generated read_prot(). imp_fun (Character string)  Function used data imputation. "SampMin", "man", "bpca", "knn", "QRILC", "MLE", "MinDet", "MinProb", "min", "zero", "mixed", "nbavg". See (rna.impute) details. q (Numeric) q value imputing missing values method imp_fun = 'MinProb'. knn.rowmax (Numeric) maximum percent missing data allowed row imp_fun = 'knn'. Default: 0.5. type (Character string) Type differential analysis perform. "" (contrast condition every condition), "control" (contrast condition defined control condition), "manual" (manually define selected conditions). design Formula design matrix. size.factors Optional: Manually define size factors normalization. altHypothesis Specify genes interested finding. test provides p values null hypothesis, complement set defined altHypothesis. details, see results. control Control condition; required type = "control". contrast (String vector strings) Defined test(s) differential analysis form "A_vs_B"; required type = "manual". controlGenes Specifying genes use size factor estimation (e.g. housekeeping spike-genes). pAdjustMethod Method adjusting p values. Available options "IHW" (Independent Hypothesis Weighting),"BH" (Benjamini-Hochberg). alpha Significance threshold adjusted p values. alpha.independent Adjusted p value threshold independent filtering NULL. adjusted p-value cutoff (FDR) value 0.1, alpha set value. alpha_pathways Significance threshold pathway analysis. lfcShrink Use shrinkage calculate log2 fold change values. shrink.method Method shrinkage. Available options "apeglm", "ashr", "normal". See lfcShrink details. lfc Relevance threshold absolute log2(fold change) values. Used filter unshrunken lfc values shrinkage method "apeglm" "normal". heatmap.show_all Shall samples displayed heatmap samples contained defined "contrast"? (applicable type = "manual") heatmap.kmeans Shall proteins clustered heat map? k Number protein clusters heat map kmeans = TRUE. heatmap.col_limit Define breaks heat map legends. heatmap.show_row_names Show protein names heat map? heatmap.row_font_size Font size protein names show_row_names = TRUE. volcano.add_names Display names next symbols volcano plot. volcano.label_size Size labels volcano plot. volcano.adjusted Display adjusted p-values y axis volcano plot? plot Shall plots returned Plots pane? export Shall plots exported PDF PNG files? report Shall report (HTML PDF) created? report.dir Folder name created report (report = TRUE) pathway_enrichment Perform pathway -representation analysis tested contrast pathway_kegg Perform pathway -representation analysis gene sets KEGG database kegg_organism Name organism KEGG database ('pathway_kegg = TRUE') custom_pathways Dataframe providing custom pathway annotations. quiet Suppress messages warnings.
